Stattdessen sind die Handwerker der Orks auf die Bergung von Rohstoffen aus Schlachten oder den Handel mit Außenstehenden angewiesen. Es ist üblich, dass ein einfaches Werkzeug, wie ein Messer oder ein Kochtopf, sehr alt ist, aber in einwandfreiem Zustand gehalten wird. Selbst wenn ein Werkzeug kaputt geht, finden die Handwerker der Orks Wege, so viel wie möglich davon wiederzuverwenden.

action->Surprise Shooter.name: Überraschungsschütze
action->Surprise Shooter.description: Die Fernkampfangriffe des Ork-Vagabunden fügen Zielen, die an mindestens einen Verbündeten des Vagabunden angrenzen, zusätzlich 1W6 Punkte Präzisionsschaden zu.

action->Counting Coup.name: Einschüchterndes Klingenspiel
action->Counting Coup.description:
Auslöser Ein Gegner bewegt sich innerhalb von Otehikas Angriffsradius

Effekt Otehika schwingt seine Waffen so nahe am Gegner wie möglich, ohne ihn zu berühren, und legt einen Wurf zum @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralisieren} ab. Bei Erfolg erhält der Gegner den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Auf dem Falschen Fuß} bis zum Beginn seines nächsten Zuges.

action->Twin Takedown.name: Zwillingsangriff
action->Twin Takedown.description:
Häufigkeit Einmal pro Runde

Anforderungen Otehika führt zwei Nahkampfwaffen, jede in einer anderen Hand

Effekt Otehika führt zwei Nahkampfangriffe gegen sien Ziel (einen Angriff mit jeder der erforderlichen Waffen). Treffen beide Angriffe dasselbe Ziel, so kombiniere den Schaden der Waffen hinsichtlich Resistenzen und Schwächen. Der Malus für Mehrfachangriffe kommt bei jedem Angriff normal zur Anwendung.

Palpares.name: Ameisenlöwe
Palpares.publicNotes:
Die alten Zwerge schenkten der Dreckssee wenig Beachtung, da sie in seinem Schlamm kaum etwas verwendbares Wertvolles sahen. Die Orks waren wesentlich mutiger, aber selbst sie hüten sich vor Monstern, die durch den Schlamm schwimmen. Für Außenstehende mögen Ameisenlöwen wie eine warnende Geschichte erscheinen, die Kinder davon abhält, im Treibsand zu versinken, und die großen Gruben, die sich an den Ufern der Dreckssee bilden, sind nur geologische Phänomene, die in der Regenzeit auftreten. Diejenigen jedoch, die über diese Fallen gestolpert sind, kennen die gefährliche Realität.

Nur wenige wissen viel über Ameisenlöwen, ein riesiges Insekt, dessen gepanzerter, massiger Hinterleib den größten Teil seines Körpers ausmacht. Sie scheinen Einzelgänger zu sein, die aus dem Hinterhalt heraus jagen und während der Trockenzeit Winterschlaf halten. Zur Regenzeit erwachen sie dann und graben ihre riesigen Grubenfallen. Diese fangen Beute jeder Größe, sogar gelegentlich ganze Herden von wandernden Auerochsen, während die Ameisenlöwen vergraben in der Mitte der Falle warten. Ameisenlöwen sind normalerweise sehr geduldig, aber wenn sie gestört werden, können sie sich überraschend schnell durch den sandigen Boden bewegen, der ihre Heimat ist, und Eindringlinge, die ihr Revier betreten, mit ihrem schaufelartigen Kopf und ihren bösartigen Scheren begrüßen.

Lebensphasen

Forschungsergebnisse deuten darauf hin, dass Ameisenlöwen noch nicht ihre endgültige Lebensform erreicht haben, da in großen Höhlen an den Ufern Spuren von Chitin und die verrottenden Überreste von teilweise transformierten Ameisenlöwen entdeckt wurden. Obwohl noch niemand einem ausgewachsenen Exemplar begegnet ist und davon erzählen könnte, gibt es Gerüchte, dass die ausgewachsene Insektenform dem Rovagug ähnelt. Gemeinschaften sind schnell dabei, alle Puppen, die sie in großen, mit Sand verkrusteten Hügeln im Dreck finden, zu lokalisieren und zu beseitigen. In einigen Städten werden große Grillfeste veranstaltet, um Tonnen von „Schlammspeck“ zu gewinnen.

action->Dig In.name: Eingraben
action->Dig In.description:
Auslöser Der Ameisenlöwe befindet sich über der Erde und würde Schaden nehmen

Effekt Der Ameisenlöwe gräbt sich mit seiner Bewegungsrate ein und wirft einen Schild aus Erde auf, der den Schaden um 11 reduziert.

action->Breaching Ambush.name: Durchbrechender Hinterhalt
action->Breaching Ambush.description:
Anforderungen Der Ameisenlöwe befindet sich unter der Erde

Effekt Der Ameisenlöwe gräbt sich mit bis zu doppelter Bewegungsrate unter eine Kreatur, greift dann mit seinen Scheren nach oben an und befindet sich schließlich über der Erde.

action->Palpares Venom.name: Ameisenlöwengift
action->Palpares Venom.description:
Rettungswurf @Check[fortitude|dc:30]{Zähigkeitswurf}

Maximaldauer 6 Runden

Phase 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]]{3W6 Punkte Giftschaden} und Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Betäubt 1} (1 Runde)

Phase 2 @Damage[3d8[poison]]{3W8 Punkte Giftschaden} und Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Betäubt 2} (1 Runde)

Phase 3 @Damage[3d10[poison]]{3W10 Punkte Giftschaden} und Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Gelähmt} (1 Minute)

action->Pit Trap.name: Trichtergrube
action->Pit Trap.description:
Der Ameisenlöwe gräbt eine schräge Grube mit einem @Template[emanation|distance:30]{Radius von 30 Fuß/9 m}, die in der Mitte 10 Fuß/3 m tief ist. Alle Kreaturen im Wirkungsbereich müssen einen @Check[reflex|dc:30]{Reflexwurf} ablegen.

Kritischer Erfolg Die Kreatur wird durch Erschütterungen auf ein Feld außerhalb des Grubenrandes bewegt.

Erfolg Wie Kritischer Erfolg, aber die Kreatur hat 1 Runde lang den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Unbeholfen 1}.

Fehlschlag Die Kreatur fällt 10 Fuß/3 m in die Grube und erleidet den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Liegend}.

Kritischer Fehlschlag Wie Fehlschlag, die Kreatur erleidet zudem den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Betäubt 1}.

action->Venomous Bite.name: Giftiger Biss
action->Venomous Bite.description:
Anforderungen Der Ameisenlöwe hat eine Kreatur in den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Gegriffen} versetzt

Effekt Der Ameisenlöwe injiziert mit seinen Mandibeln Gift, verursacht @Damage[3d8[acid]]{3W8 Punkte Säureschaden} und setzt die Kreatur dem Ameisenlöwengift aus.

action->Dance Between the Blades.name: Tanz zwischen den Klingen
action->Dance Between the Blades.description:
Auslöser Ein Gegner im Angriffsradius von Paskis erleidet einen Kritischen Fehlschlag bei einem Angriff gegen sie

Effekt Paskis kann einen Schritt ausführen; sie muss ihre Bewegung innerhalb des Angriffsradius des auslösenden Gegners beenden. Paskis führt dann einen Nahkampfangriff gegen die auslösende Kreatur aus und behandelt sie für den Angriff als @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Auf dem Falschen Fuß} erwischt. Bei diesem Angriff wird der Schaden des auslösenden Angriffs und nicht der Schaden von Paskis‘ Waffe verwendet. Wenn die Waffe über die Eigenschaft Agil oder Finesse verfügt, wendet Paskis auch bei diesem Schaden ihren Hinterhältigen Angriff an.

action->Deny Advantage.name: Vorteil verweigern
action->Deny Advantage.description: Paskis ist nicht @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Auf dem Falschen Fuß} betroffen, wenn Kreaturen der 11. Stufe oder niedriger ihr gegenüber @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Versteckt} oder Unentdeckt sind, sie Flankieren oder mit Überraschungsangriffen agieren. Sie kann Verbündeten jedoch beim Flankieren helfen.

action->Enfeebling Strike.name: Entkräftender Angriff
action->Enfeebling Strike.description:
Auslöser Paskis‘ Angriff trifft eine Kreatur, die sich @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Auf dem Falschen Fuß} befindet und fügt ihr Schaden zu

Effekt Das Ziel erleidet bis zum Ende von Paskis‘ nächstem Zug den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Kraftlos 1}

action->Knife Training.name: Messerkünstlerin
action->Knife Training.description: Paskis behandelt alle Waffen in der Messergruppe als Waffen der Kategorie Finesse.

action->Lightning Blades.name: Blitzschnelle Klingen
action->Lightning Blades.description:
Anforderungen Paskis benutzt zwei Messer und zielt auf eine Kreatur, die @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Auf dem Falschen Fuß} erwischt ist.

Effekt Paskis führt zwei Messer-Angriffe gegen die Kreatur aus. Diese Angriffe erhöhen ihren Malus für Mehrfachangriffe, aber der Malus erhöht sich erst nach beiden Angriffen. Bei der Finte zählt dies als ein einzelner Nahkampfangriff.

action->Mark for Death.name: Todeskandidat
action->Mark for Death.description:
Anforderungen Paskis kann die Kreatur beobachten, welche sie auswählen will

Effekt Paskis bestimmt eine einzelne Kreatur als ihr Ziel. Dies gilt, bis das Ziel stirbt oder sie erneut Todeskandidat einsetzt. Sie erhält einen Situationsbonus von +2 auf Wahrnehmungswürfe, um das Ziel zu @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Suchen}, und auf Würfe für Täuschung, um eine @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Finte} gegen das Ziel auszuführen. Außerdem verursachen ihre Hinterhältigen Angriffe gegen das Ziel zusätzlich 2 Punkte Präzisionsschaden.

action->Poison Weapon.name: Waffe vergiften
action->Poison Weapon.description: Paskis zieht ein Gift und trägt es auf eine Waffe auf. Wenn ihr nächster Angriff mit dieser Waffe vor dem Ende ihres nächsten Zuges trifft und Schaden verursacht, werden die Auswirkungen des Giftes angewendet.

action->Sneak Attack.description: Paskis fügt Kreaturen, die @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Auf dem Falschen Fuß} erwischt sind, zusätzlich 3W6 Punkte Präzisionsschaden zu.

action->Surprise Attack.name: Überraschungsangriff
action->Surprise Attack.description: In der ersten Kampfrunde gelten Kreaturen, die noch nicht agiert haben, für Paskis als @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Auf dem Falschen Fuß} erwischt.

action->Double Shot.name: Doppelschuss
action->Double Shot.description: Der Porphyrwächter führt zwei Angriffe mit dem Langbogen gegen zwei verschiedene Kreaturen innerhalb der ersten Entfernungseinheit des Langbogens aus. Beide Angriffe verwenden den aktuellen Malus für Mehrfachangriffe des Wächters, aber jeder Angriff hat einen Malus von –2.

action->Weapon Master.name: Waffenmeister
action->Weapon Master.description: Der Porphyrwächter hat Zugriff auf die Kritischen Spezialisierungseffekte aller Waffen, die er führt.

action->Shield Warden.name: Schildhüter
action->Shield Warden.description: Wenn der Schildträger seinen Schild gehoben hat, kann er Schildblock nutzen, wenn ein Angriff gegen einen Verbündeten in der Nähe ausgeführt wird. Wenn dies der Fall ist, verhindert der Schild, dass dieser Verbündete Schaden erleidet anstelle des Schildträgers.

action->Offensive Block.name: Offensiver Block
action->Offensive Block.description: Der Schildträger kann in beliebiger Reihenfolge einen Schritt machen, einen Schildschlag ausführen und seinen Schild heben.

action->Retributive Bash.name: Vergeltungsschildstoß
action->Retributive Bash.description: Der Porphyrschildträger fügt zusätzlich 1W8 Schaden mit Waffenangriffen gegen jede Kreatur zu, die dem Schildträger oder einem angrenzenden Verbündeten seit Beginn der letzten Runde des Schildträgers Schaden zugefügt hat.

action->Tenacious Shield.name: Widerstandsfähiger Schild
action->Tenacious Shield.description:
Häufigkeit Einmal am Tag

Auslöser Der Schild des Schildträgers würde zerstört

Effekt Der Schild wird nicht zerstört und seine Trefferpunkte werden stattdessen um 5 reduziert.

Shadefield Spirit.name: Shadefield Spirit
Shadefield Spirit.publicNotes:
The ghost commoner is an ordinary person who believes they died unjustly.

When some mortals die through tragic circumstances or without closure, their souls can linger and haunt a locale significant to them in life.

action->Site Bound.name: Ortsgebunden
action->Site Bound.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.BcSlVpaN72LoQ5BV]

The Shadefield spirit is bound to the Shadefields.

A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Wiederkehr
action->Rejuvenation.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.unR8VVR4yyRnsmnB]

Putting Diskah Night Watcher's spirit to rest allows the Shadefield spirit to return to its original role as a guardian haunt.

When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

action->Cindery Assault.name: Cindery Assault
action->Cindery Assault.description: The Shadefield spirit cries out in pain and anguish as flaming objects and debris fly about in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Creatures in this area take @Damage[3d6[bludgeoning],1d6[persistent,fire]|options:area-damage]{3d6 bludgeoning damage plus 1d6 persistent fire damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|options:area-effect] save).

action->Corrupting Gaze.name: Verderbender Blick
action->Corrupting Gaze.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.ga0Oj7mmjSwWQgmR]

The Shadefield spirit stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. The target takes @Damage[3d6[void]] damage (@Check[will|dc:20|basic] save). A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.

action->Sworn to the Storm.name: Sworn to the Storm
action->Sworn to the Storm.description: The Shadefield spirit gains a +1 circumstance bonus to attacks against creatures that have attempted to Disable the Shoanti ancestor storm.

Shoanti Ancestor Storm.name: Shoanti Ancestor Storm
Shoanti Ancestor Storm.description: Smoke and fire explode up around the boundaries of the storm, accusatory screams and threats of violence echoing over the winds and crackling of flames. Broken weapons and shields litter the ground and Shoanti warriors emerge from the smoke, blood running down their faces as they prepare for battle.
Shoanti Ancestor Storm.disable: @Check[occultism|dc:26] to redirect the anger of the haunt back onto itself, @Check[intimidation|dc:28] to goad the Shadefield spirits into attacking someone outside of the ritual circle, or @Check[religion|dc:28] to assuage the spirits in the area. Four successes are needed to disable the haunt long enough for the ritual to be completed.
Shoanti Ancestor Storm.reset: The haunt deactivates 1 minute after all creatures leave the Shadefields but resets immediately. The haunt is only permanently disabled when Diskah Night Watcher is put to rest. Otherwise, the haunt reforms within 24 hours of being Disabled.
Shoanti Ancestor Storm.routine: (4 actions) The ancestor storm uses 1 action to release a pulse of void energy, restoring @Damage[10[healing]] Hit Points to each Shadefield spirit in the area, before using its next 2 actions to make an arrows of rage Strike against all non-Shoanti creatures within 60 feet of the cairn. The haunt then uses its 4th action to use Calling the Blood on one random leader participating in the ritual. The haunt loses an action for each Shadefield spirit killed, and when there are no Shadefield spirits remaining, the haunt uses its next action to summon a new Shadefield spirit into the battle.
Shoanti Ancestor Storm.stealth: (trained) to notice the smoke intensifying and filling with the tortured faces of lost souls

action->Ancestors' Wrath.name: Ancestors' Wrath
action->Ancestors' Wrath.description:
Trigger The ritual begins

Effect The ancestor storm howls in fury and pain. This deals @Damage[(2d10+11)[spirit]] damage to all non-Shoanti creatures in the area, who must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:28|basic] save. The haunt then rolls initiative.

action->Calling the Blood.name: Calling the Blood
action->Calling the Blood.description: The ancestor storm randomly chooses a Shoanti ritualist to distract. The ritualist must attempt a @Check[will|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the voices of their ancestors for 1 round, increasing the DCs to Disable the haunt by 2 for the duration.

action->Arrows of Rage.name: Arrows of Rage
action->Arrows of Rage.description: The hazard makes an arrows of rage Strike against all non-Shoanti creatures within 60 feet of the cairn.

Skeletal Drummer.name: Skeletal Drummer
Skeletal Drummer.publicNotes: To some, music is more than a hobby-it's an obsession. Every musician who lived and died for their craft runs the risk of returning as a fiddling bones, as do musicians who died before completing their magnum opus or receiving the accolades they believe they deserved. Driven to prove themselves even in undeath, fiddling bones often challenge famous performers to music duels.

equipment->Drum.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MPv5Yx4w7scZGj2Y]
Drum

action->Rhapsodic Flourish.name: Rhapsodic Flourish
action->Rhapsodic Flourish.description:
Trigger The skeletal drummer would roll a saving throw against an auditory or sonic effect

Effect The skeletal drummer performs a refrain that deflects sonic vibrations. They roll a Performance check in place of the triggering saving throw. Sonic feedback rebounds from the effect, dealing @Damage[1d6[sonic]] damage to the source of the triggering effect if the Performance check succeeded or @Damage[2d6[sonic]] damage to the skeletal drummer on a failure.

action->Destructive Finale.name: Destructive Finale
action->Destructive Finale.description:
Requirements March to War is in effect

Effect The skeletal drummer performs a boisterous finale. They choose a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] or @Template[type:emanation|distance:15], and they deal @Damage[4d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage to all creatures in that area (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). March to War immediately ends, and the skeletal drummer can't use March to War or Destructive Finale for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Destructive Finale]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->March to War.name: March to War
action->March to War.description:
The skeletal drummer plays a regular beat that compels others to march. Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] must attempt a @Check[will|dc:19] save. Undead are immune. The effect lasts until the end of the skeletal drummer's next turn, but the skeletal drummer can Sustain the effect on all affected creatures that remain within the emanation.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Success The creature can't use actions with the move trait except to march, which uses the Stride action to move up to half the creature's Speed. If the creature has other Speeds, it can also march using those modes of travel.

Failure As success, and the creature must spend at least 1 action each turn marching.

action->Hard to Target.name: Hard to Target
action->Hard to Target.description: With their loose, shifting skin, a skinslough's vital organs are difficult to locate. Each time a skinslough would take precision damage or extra damage from a critical hit, it attempts a @Check[flat|dc:5]. On a success, the additional damage is negated.

action->Slough.name: Slough
action->Slough.description:
Trigger The skinslough gains a persistent damage condition or becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The skinslough sheds part of its skin and attempts a @Check[flat|dc:5] to end the condition.

action->Skin Net.name: Skin Net
action->Skin Net.description:
The skinslough interacts to pull off part of its skin and throw it at a creature within 30 feet, making a ranged attack with a +12 modifier. If it hits, the target takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 round and must make a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save. If the skinslough critically hits, the target gets a result one degree of success worse than the outcome of its Fortitude save.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.2tOVDTjCZVx4uEjP]{Effect: Skin Net}

Critical Success As success, and the creature automatically succeeds at saving throws against the skinslough's Skin Net for 24 hours.

Success The target is unaffected except for the penalty to Speed.

Failure The target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

action->Sloughing Sickness.name: Sloughing Sickness
action->Sloughing Sickness.description:
This horrifying disease can make a target's skin slough away.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 hour)

Stage 2 @Damage[(2d4+4)[void]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[(4d4+4)[void]] damage, clumsy 1, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day).

action->Counting Coup.name: Counting Coup
action->Counting Coup.description:
Trigger An enemy moves within the Sklar-Quah warrior's reach

Effect The Sklar-Quah warrior swings their weapon as close to their enemy as they can without touching them, immediately attempting a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} check. On a success, the enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of their next turn.

action->Guerrilla Tactics.name: Guerrilla Tactics
action->Guerrilla Tactics.description:
Requirements The Sklar-Quah warrior is holding their hatchet

Effect The Sklar-Quah warrior makes a ranged Strike with their hatchet and then draws their battle axe.

Slamming Gate.name: Slamming Gate
Slamming Gate.description: A pressure-sensitive floor panel causes a spiked door to slam down into place from the ceiling, skewering anyone caught underneath.
Slamming Gate.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:26] (trained) to jam either the floor panel or the associated winch

action->Slam Closed.name: Slam Closed
action->Slam Closed.description:
Trigger Pressure is placed on the associated floor tile

Effect The door falls, closing off the hallway. The door deals @Damage[(3d8+3)[bludgeoning],(3d8+3)[piercing]]{3d8+3 bludgeoning damage and 3d8+3 piercing} damage to anyone beneath or adjacent to the door when it falls, and it pushes them out of its space (away from the door, or in a random direction if the creature is directly beneath the door) as it falls. A creature that succeeds at a @Check[reflex|dc:22] save takes no damage and moves out of the way in a random direction. On a critical success, they choose the direction.

Lifting the closed door requires a successful @Check[athletics|dc:25] check. Hitting the floor panels triggers the trap. The slab uses the same AC and saves as the trap, but it has Hardness 8 and 60 HP (BT 30).

Spite-Screamer.name: Spite-Screamer
Spite-Screamer.publicNotes:
Wights are intelligent undead spawned through inescapable cycles of spite. This spite might come from their own malevolent will in life, or can be instilled by necromantic rituals, typically involving the desecration of burial sites. Wights usually haunt burial grounds, catacombs, or other places of the dead. Their hunger is targeted toward the living—those whose pumping hearts and ruddy warmth inspire visceral hatred.

As many types of wights exist as types of people from which they might be created. Hulking brutes, skittering sneaks, and cunning tinkers all make for different wights with different niches to fill. The environment, too, plays a part in determining a wight's special abilities and defenses. Frost wights, for instance, can be found in parts of the world where exposure is a common end and the resentment of being left alone in the wild is a common source of spite. Durable and sustained by void energy, wights can last in harsh environments without decaying the way some lesser undead do.

A single wight can wreak significant havoc if it is compelled to rise from its tomb. Because creatures slain under a wight's curse can become wights as well, all it takes is a single wight and a handful of unlucky graveyard visitors to create a veritable horde of these undead. Thus, canny priests and adventurers know that the best solution to a wight problem is swift and total eradication. Care must be taken, though, to destroy wight spawn before attempting to destroy the parent wight, for spawn without a master gain the ability to create spawn of their own.

action->Grave Weapon.name: Grave Weapon
action->Grave Weapon.description: This wight is bound to the falchion it died with.

action->Final Spite.name: Final Spite
action->Final Spite.description:
Trigger The wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The wight makes a Strike before being destroyed. This Strike can inflict corrupting spite, but fueled by spite doesn't apply.

action->Fueled by Spite.name: Fueled by Spite
action->Fueled by Spite.description: Each time a creature loses Hit Points due to a corrupting spite curse the wight inflicted, the wight gains 5 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute.

action->Cleaving Rush.name: Cleaving Rush
action->Cleaving Rush.description: The spite-screamer Strides and makes two melee Strikes at any point during that movement.

action->Corrupting Spite.name: Corrupting Spite
action->Corrupting Spite.description:
The wight's unarmed attacks and bound weapons inflict a curse that makes a creature grow weak and spiteful. If a wight inflicts corrupting spite on a creature already afflicted by it, the victim attempts a new save, ignoring the result if it's better than a failure.

A living humanoid that dies while under the curse rises as a wight after [[/gmr 1d4 #Wight Spawn Timer]]{1d4 rounds}, controlled by the wight that killed it. The wight spawn can't inflict corrupting spite and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}. If its creator dies or after roughly a month of existence, the new wight becomes autonomous and turns into a normal wight

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:22];

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and doesn't treat any creatures as allies (1 round)

Stage 3 As stage 2, except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} (1 round)

Stage 4 As stage 2, except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4} (1 round).

Stonegutter Mold.name: Stonegutter Mold
Stonegutter Mold.description: A hardy, innocuous-looking green mold grows over surfaces, slowly absorbing minerals.
Stonegutter Mold.disable: @Check[survival|dc:26] (trained) to scrape away the mold without touching it
Stonegutter Mold.reset: 1 hour, as the mold settles back across the surface.

action->Calcium Consumption.name: Calcium Consumption
action->Calcium Consumption.description:
Trigger A creature with bones touches the mold or steps into an area covered with it

Effect The mold shudders and slithers onto the triggering creature as it attempts to absorb calcium through their skin. The creature attempts a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25] save.

Critical Success The target shakes the mold off and is unaffected.

Success A small patch of mold clings to the target and deals @Damage[(2d10+9)[piercing]] damage.

Failure The mold clings to the target. The target takes @Damage[(4d10+18)[piercing]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Critical Failure The mold envelops the target. As failure, except the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until it's healed to its Hit Point maximum.

Note: A DC was not provided for this ability by Paizo. The DC present here is a hard DC for the hazard level according to the GM Core hazard building Tables.

Stormblood Tiger.name: Stormblood Tiger
Stormblood Tiger.publicNotes:
Whereas most werecreatures follow the monthly rhythms of the full moon, the stormblood tiger's change is connected to the floods brought by annual rainfall. In parts of the world where flooding or heavy rains are both regular and predictable, such as during the Deluge in Belkzen, these lycanthropes stalk the land hunting for prey. Every night after the floods begin, a stormblood tiger is forced into its hybrid form until sun rises or the waters recede, usually 2–3 months later. The remainder of the year, stormblood tigers walk undetected among the population, often mistaken for hunters or scouts.

Sought Out

Because of the stormblood tiger's fearsome reputation and powerful abilities, some foolhardy orc warriors view becoming a stormblood tiger as a path to greatness—a blessing instead of a curse. In their minds, it's more important to have this power at hand during times of conflict than worry about disrupting peace during the Flood Truce. Wiser voices argue that too many stormblood tigers roaming about during the Flood Truce risks ending the accord altogether.

action->Tiger Empathy.name: Tiger Empathy
action->Tiger Empathy.description: The stormblood tiger can communicate with felines.

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
Orc with fist +16 for 1d4+12 bludgeoning, or tiger with Speed 30 feet and Wrestle.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Curse of the Stormblood Tiger.name: Curse of the Stormblood Tiger
action->Curse of the Stormblood Tiger.description:
This curse only affects humanoids.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:22]. Each night of flood season, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or transform into a stormblood tiger until dawn. The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} until dawn.

action->Flood Frenzy.name: Flood Frenzy
action->Flood Frenzy.description: As the night falls in flood season, the stormblood tiger must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of its jaws Strike by 2. When the sun rises or the lands dry again, the stormblood tiger returns to humanoid form and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for 24 hours.

action->Sudden Pounce.name: Sudden Pounce
action->Sudden Pounce.description: Imbued with an insatiable predatory instinct, stormblood tiger Leaps up to 15 feet and makes a claw Strike at the end of that movement. If the attack hits, the stormblood tiger can immediately Rend.

action->Wrestle.name: Wrestle
action->Wrestle.description: The tiger makes a claw Strike against a creature it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbing}. If the attack hits, that creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Tar-Baphon's Shadow.name: Tar-Baphon's Shadow
Tar-Baphon's Shadow.description: A manifestation of Tar-Baphon drains the essence of its divine target.
Tar-Baphon's Shadow.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:33] (expert) to disrupt Tar-Baphon's magic, @Check[occultism|dc:30] or @Check[religion|dc:30] (master) to suppress the shadow's energy; three total successes in any combination are required to disable the haunt unless the Carcass Man is destroyed, in which case it's automatically destroyed
Tar-Baphon's Shadow.routine: (1 action; death) The haunt drains Zagresh's divine energies, dealing @Damage[5d10[void]] damage.

action->Unholy Leech.name: Unholy Leech
action->Unholy Leech.description:
Trigger A creature enters the cavern

Effect The shadow latches onto the Carcass Man, unleashing a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] of necromantic energy. Creatures in the area except the Carcass Man must make a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save or take @Damage[2d12[void]] damage. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is pushed back 5 feet.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is pushed back 15 feet.

Critical Failure As failure and the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Unholy Presence.name: Unholy Presence
action->Unholy Presence.description: The shadow is sustained by the power of Tar-Baphon, regaining 10 Hit Points at the beginning of every round, and is repaired by void damage.

The Carcass Man.name: The Carcass Man
The Carcass Man.saveDetails: +2 status to all saves vs. fear and magic

action->+2 Status to All Saves vs. Fear.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kquBnQ0kObZztnBc]
+2 Status to All Saves vs. Fear and Magic

action->Annihilation Aura.name: Annihilation Aura
action->Annihilation Aura.description:
20 feet. The Carcass Man's form exudes the impulse to destroy. Upon entering the aura, creatures must attempt a @Check[will|dc:31] save. Regardless of the results, creatures are temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success Urges to attack cloud the creature's mind and if they do not deal damage to another creature on their turn, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the end of their next turn.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} until the end of their next turn.

Critical Failure The creature is confused for 1 minute.

action->Neck Snap.name: Neck Snap
action->Neck Snap.description:
Requirements The Carcass Man has a creature Grabbed

Effect The creature takes @Damage[6d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:31|basic] save); a creature that critically fails their save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} until they heal at least 30 HP. The Carcass Man then releases the creature.

action->Revel in Destruction.name: Revel in Destruction
action->Revel in Destruction.description:
Requirements The Carcass Man's last action reduced a creature to 0 HP

Effect The Carcass Man exults in his victory, painting his face in the creature's blood. He is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} until the end of his next turn but can use this extra action only to Strike. Non-worshippers of Zagresh who witness the display must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:31] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

action->Three-Arm Devastation.name: Three-Arm Devastation
action->Three-Arm Devastation.description: The Carcass Man attempts a melee Strike against a creature within his reach. If the Strike hits and deals damage, he can attempt two additional melee Strikes with his other arms against two other creatures within his reach; each of the three Strikes must target a different creature. These attacks increase his multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until all three attacks have been made.

Tooth Fairy Leader.name: Tooth Fairy Leader
Tooth Fairy Leader.publicNotes:
Lone fairies usually need several minutes of elbow grease and a sleeping or restrained subject to extract a tooth.

Tooth fairies spawn when a child's tooth (or, less commonly, an entire child) is buried in terrain rife with fey energies. Hatching from the buried teeth like larvae from an egg, tooth fairies build crude pliers from whatever they can find, then go hunting for more teeth—regardless of the owners' willingness.

action->Plaque Burst.name: Plaque Burst
action->Plaque Burst.description: When killed, a tooth fairy bursts into sticky, foul-smelling white dust. Each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:5] must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

action->Tooth Tug.name: Tooth Tug
action->Tooth Tug.description:
Requirements The tooth fairy's last action was a successful pliers Strike against a creature with teeth

Effect The tooth fairy attempts a @Check[thievery|defense:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC, dealing @Damage[2[bleed]] damage on any result but a critical failure. On a critical success, it also pulls out one of the target's teeth.

If the creature loses a tooth, it takes a –1 status penalty to Charisma-based skill checks and must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] to Cast a Spell unless that spell has the subtle trait. These effects last for 1 day, or until the stolen tooth is returned and the target regains at least 1 Hit Point.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4q8Of8NM9DC8kWyK]{Effect: Tooth Tug}

Trampling Livestock.name: Trampling Livestock
Trampling Livestock.description: Several ghostly mammoths arise from the floorboards, pawing at the ground in terror before stampeding toward the door.
Trampling Livestock.disable: @Check[religion|dc:28] to exorcise the animals' spirits, or @Check[nature|dc:26] or @Check[Stabling Lore|dc:24] to soothe them

action->Sudden Stampede.name: Sudden Stampede
action->Sudden Stampede.description:
Trigger The door to the stable opens

Effect The mammoth spirits activate in panic, materializing into physical forms as they stampede toward the door to escape. All creatures standing within 20 feet of the door take @Damage[(4d10+26)[force]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save).

Trighoul.name: Trighoul
Trighoul.publicNotes:
Despite the name given by orcs of the Dirt Sea, the trighoul is not a ghoul at all, but a mutagenic abomination. Its three tentacles bristle with hundreds of neural spines that let it "glide" across the sands at high speed and manipulate the nervous system of a corpse through the spinal column. Trighouls were originally created over a thousand years ago by fleshwarpers aligned with the Whispering Tyrant, giving them to raiders as weapons. While the use of trighouls is now regarded with shame and disgust, some still take advantage of the creatures to lure enemies to their deaths using the corpses of their slain comrades.

Puppetmaster Serum

Orc alchemists familiar with fleshwarping techniques have synthesized an elixir called puppetmaster extract. The elixir transforms the drinker's limb into a tentacle that can temporarily animate the dead. One must take great care when crafting the serum, as incorrectly mixed batches have been known to dissolve organs from within, cause permanent paralysis, and grow tentacles in unwanted places.

action->Pain Sensitivity.name: Pain Sensitivity
action->Pain Sensitivity.description: When a trighoul's tentacle is severed, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. Its Speed is reduced by 15 feet until the tentacle is regrown.

action->Tentacle Regrowth.name: Tentacle Regrowth
action->Tentacle Regrowth.description: A trighoul ordinarily has three tentacles. A creature can attempt to sever a tentacle by specifically targeting it and dealing damage equal to the tentacle's Hit Points. A tentacle that isn't severed completely returns to full Hit Points at the end of any creature's turn. A severed trighoul tentacles regrows, restored to full Hit Points, after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Puppet Show.name: Puppet Show
action->Puppet Show.description:
1 to 3

Requirements The trighoul is using Puppeteer Corpse

Effect The trighoul manipulates up to three corpses to silently Impersonate the living. A creature that fails to detect the deception is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the trighoul's corpse Strike. The deception ends immediately after the trighoul attacks.

action->Puppeteer Corpse.name: Puppeteer Corpse
action->Puppeteer Corpse.description:
Requirements The trighoul is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, and there's at least one corpse within 10 feet

Effect The trighoul attaches a tentacle to the corpse of a Large to Small creature. That tentacle replaces its Strike with a melee corpse Strike that deals bludgeoning damage equal to the total damage dealt by its tentacle. A controlled corpse is destroyed when it takes 20 Hit Points of damage. The trighoul can detach from a corpse as a single action with the manipulate trait.

Troll.name: Troll
Troll.publicNotes:
Forest trolls are gangly giants who stalk the fringes of civilization. They rely on their incredible strength to overpower foes with their vicious claws and toothy maws. These trolls stand anywhere from 12 to 16 feet tall, though they prefer to hunch for comfort and to lull foes into a false sense of security. Trolls are truly creatures of the forest, deeply linked in flesh and blood to the verdant habitats they consider their territory. In fact, when a forest troll is killed, their flesh turns into blackened lumps of charcoal, often still glowing with coals. Despite that, these creatures roam farther and wider than most of their kin, to the extent that they're the first creatures a common person thinks of when they hear the word "troll."

Slavering, cruel, invincible brutes: this is the villager's stock description for the dread monsters known as trolls. The roots of these stories are undoubtedly true. Trolls' flesh endlessly regrows, going so far as to sprout aberrant limbs or additional heads if not pruned, and a bottomless hunger is required to feed such unfettered growth. Even in the process of glutting themselves, however, trolls find opportunities to taunt their prey and inflict petty cruelties.

A troll's ability to survive is so strong that they believe even the smallest scrap of flesh will slowly regenerate into a new form, suffering as all the powers of the land are gathered to revive them. Despite the pain, trolls speak of this unassailable vitality as a blessing from their creator. Few trolls have heard the laughter of demons who claim that creator cursed the trolls and cast them down from lofty heights, binding them so they could never rise again.

Trolls prefer to remain solitary, keeping every scrap of food for themselves. In rare instances, an old and powerful troll comes to lead groups of trolls. Such warleaders possess enough cunning to lead their hordes in devastating raids and massacres, and their presence permanently alters the surrounding ecosystem. This link to their environment is an often misunderstood aspect of trollkind, and grows more acute with a troll's age and power. That's not to say trolls are valorous protectors of nature. They're vicious and territorial, and will blight their own territory forever if it means more to eat for a day.

action->Easily Misled.name: Easily Misled
action->Easily Misled.description: The forest troll gets a –4 circumstance penalty to their Perception DC against Deception checks.

action->Furious Flailing.name: Furious Flailing
action->Furious Flailing.description:
Trigger The forest troll takes electricity or fire damage

Effect The troll makes a claw Strike against a random creature within its reach. If the troll has persistent fire damage, they attempt a @Check[flat|dc:15] to remove it.

action->Chase Prey.name: Chase Prey
action->Chase Prey.description: The forest troll rushes forward on all fours, Striding and then making two claw Strikes.

Tusk Mountains Avalanche.name: Tusk Mountains Avalanche
Tusk Mountains Avalanche.description: Snow and ice gathered at the peaks of the mountain come crashing down in an explosive wave.
Tusk Mountains Avalanche.disable: Three @Check[crafting|dc:34] or @Check[Engineering Lore|dc:34] (expert) to create cover for a 10-foot square area and shelter from the avalanche; a flying creature can attempt a @Check[acrobatics|dc:29] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Qf1ylAbdVi1rkc8M]{Maneuver in Flight} to avoid the avalanche

action->Cascade.name: Cascade
action->Cascade.description:
Trigger The zombie mammoth horde moves beneath the peaks

Effect An avalanche of snow and ice cascades down the mountainside at astonishing speed. All creatures on the ground within a 200-foot radius must attempt @Check[reflex|dc:30] saves.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage and @Damage[4d6[cold]] damage.

Failure The creature is swept away, moving 200 feet down the mountainside, and takes @Damage[8d6[bludgeoning]] damage and @Damage[8d6[cold]] damage.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is also buried, taking an additional @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]] damage and then @Damage[1d6[cold]] damage per minute of burial. Locating a buried creature requires a @Check[perception|dc:28] or @Check[survival|dc:28] check; once located, a buried creature can be extricated with a @Check[athletics|dc:28] check in one round or dug out with a @Check[athletics|dc:23] check with 4 minutes of work.

Tyrant's Orders.name: Tyrant's Orders
Tyrant's Orders.description: Yagrekash appears to berate weak soldiers for not doing their part.
Tyrant's Orders.disable: @Check[deception|dc:28] (expert) or @Check[performance|dc:28] (expert) to feign joining the fray, or @Check[religion|dc:30] (master) to ward Yagrekash away; three total successes in any combination are required to disable the haunt
Tyrant's Orders.reset: The haunt deactivates 1 minute after all creatures leave the area of Fort Whiteskull but resets immediately. Tyrant's orders resets 1 day after being disabled if the ancestor storm isn't put to rest.

action->Command of the Legion.name: Command of the Legion
action->Command of the Legion.description:
Trigger A PC critically fails a skill check to navigate the ancestor storm

Effect Yagrekash barks orders at the PCs to join the battle. All PCs must attempt a @Check[will|dc:27] save; orc and dromaar PCs take a –1 penalty.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} for 1 minute.

Failure The creature is compelled to join the Umbra Legion in battle, taking @Damage[(2d12+13)[mental]] damage.

Critical Failure As failure, but the damage is doubled.

Umbra's Rage.name: Umbra's Rage
Umbra's Rage.description: The anger of the fallen Umbra Legion seeps into any creature entering combat.
Umbra's Rage.disable: @Check[religion|dc:26] (expert) to exorcise the closest spirits or @Check[diplomacy|dc:30] (expert) to calm them down

action->Curse of Eternal Battle.name: Curse of Eternal Battle
action->Curse of Eternal Battle.description:
Trigger A creature enters combat while in Umbra's Last Stand

Effect The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:26] save as the rage of the surrounding orcs threatens to overwhelm them.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is confused for 1 minute.

action->+1 Vs. Fear.name:

+1 Vs. Fear

action->Cursebound.name: Cursebound
action->Cursebound.description: Using a cursebound ability makes Ungukk @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} or increases his enfeebled value by 1, to a maximum of 3. If he reaches @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}, he also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

action->Curse of the Fallen Divine.name: Curse of the Fallen Divine
action->Curse of the Fallen Divine.description: Ungukk increases the damage of a spell he casts by 1 die.

action->Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
action->Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If Ungukk's next action is to cast a cantrip or a spell of 4th rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum of 1 action).

action->Roar of Zagresh.name: Roar of Zagresh
action->Roar of Zagresh.description: With a mighty roar, Ungukk unleashes void energy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Creatures in the area must make a @Check[fortitude|dc:30|options:area-effect,damaging-effect,inflicts:doomed] save or take @Damage[6d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage and become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2} on a critical failure).

action->Undying Conviction.name: Undying Conviction
action->Undying Conviction.description: 30 feet. Ungukk's undead allies within his aura gain a +2 status bonus to saving throws to resist vitality damage and to Will saving throws to resist effects that would make them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled}.

action->Blade Ally.name: Blade Ally
action->Blade Ally.description: In her hands, Verthok's orc necksplitter is a fearsome weapon, and she gains the axe critical hit effect.

action->Destructive Vengeance.name: Destructive Vengeance
action->Destructive Vengeance.description:
Trigger An enemy within 15 feet damages Verthok

Effect Verthok increases the amount of damage she takes by @Damage[1d6[untyped]], and she deals @Damage[3d6[spirit]] or @Damage[3d6[void]] damage to the triggering enemy. An enemy damaged by Destructive Vengeance takes @Damage[4[persistent,spirit]] damage. Until the end of Verthok's next turn, her Strikes against the triggering creature deal 2 extra damage of the type she chose.

action->Bloody Assault.name: Bloody Assault
action->Bloody Assault.description: Verthok makes two melee Strikes, each against a different opponent; her multiple attack penalty applies to these Strikes normally. If both Strikes hit and deal damage, each creature struck takes @Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]] damage.

action->Greater Cruelty.name: Greater Cruelty
action->Greater Cruelty.description: If Verthok's next action is to cast touch of the void on a living creature, the target is also enfeebled, clumsy, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute if it fails its save (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure).

action->Mask's Glare.name: Mask's Glare
action->Mask's Glare.description: Once per day, Verthok can use her demon mask to cast 3rd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D]{Fear} with a DC of @Check[will|dc:29].

War Auroch.name: War Auroch
War Auroch.publicNotes:
War aurochs are especially large versions aurochs bred to pull war machines as their primary duty. Particularly aggressive calves are selected for additional training to fight in battle as support for warriors.

Belkzen's megafauna husbandry is a source of orc pride, with many species bred for everyday life. In battle, they provide an edge against foes.

War Barding

A war aurochs is often fitted with pieces of armor to make its attacks deadlier, such as spiked ornaments on their horns or sharp-toed hoof shoes. The symbol of a hold is painted directly onto the beast's hide and left there even if another hold captures it, where it's often treated as a prisoner of war.

action->Bellow.name: Bellow
action->Bellow.description: The war aurochs bellows aggressively, attempting a single Intimidation check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} against all enemies within 30 feet.

action->Stomp.name: Stomp
action->Stomp.description: The war aurochs strikes the ground with its hooves, causing tremors in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:25] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Trample.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.UNah0bxXxkcZjxO3]

Large or smaller, hoof, @Check[reflex|dc:25|basic]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Trample]

War Pig.name: War Pig
War Pig.publicNotes:
While not native to Belkzen, these swine instead descended from livestock raided and re-homed millennia ago during orc raids. Generations of selective breeding favored larger animals suited to Belkzen's harsh environment and fearsome predators, resulting in the modern war pig. During the flood season, these pigs gorge and grow fat, gradually consuming their reserves to become leaner and meaner during the rest of the year.

Arguably domesticated, war pigs rarely remain in captivity for more than a few generations. Most orcs loathe the notion of their swine becoming too tame, instead releasing part of their herd every year to grow fierce before recapturing them seasons later. The downside is that these feral swine associate humanoids with food. Rogue war pigs sometimes form roving gangs that uproot fields, run amok, and even knock over trade caravans to eat rations (and the occasional merchant).

The "war" in war pigs comes from their use as mounts. With the right motivation, a war pig is a porcine juggernaut able to carry a fully armored orc into combat. Without discipline, care, and treats, that same pig can become 600 pounds of willful chaos that's as likely to trample foes as it is to flee combat, find a mud puddle, and crush its rider after flopping down to vigorously wallow.

action->Squealed Outrage.name: Squealed Outrage
action->Squealed Outrage.description:
Trigger The war pig is damaged by an adjacent creature

Effect The war pig makes a hoof Strike at the triggering creature.

action->Bulldoze.name: Bulldoze
action->Bulldoze.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The war pig Shoves an adjacent creature, after which it can either Stride or Step.

action->Wallow.name: Wallow
action->Wallow.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The war pig rapidly rolls over. If it has a rider, the war pig @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.nZMQh4AaBr291TUf]{Bucks} as a free action. The war pig gains 1d8 temporary Hit Points for 1 minute and can then attempt an immediate flat check to recover from a single source of persistent acid, fire, or mental damage. If the war pig Wallows in an area with ample mud, water, loose soil, or similar material, the war pig instead gains 2d8 temporary Hit Points, for 1 minute and reduces the flat check DC to recover from persistent damage by 1.

Warcat of Rull.name: Warcat of Rull
Warcat of Rull.publicNotes:
These fierce hippo-sized cats with scaly, armored skin can only be bred and trained by the most skilled handlers.

Belkzen's megafauna husbandry is a source of orc pride, with many species bred for everyday life. In battle, they provide an edge against foes.

Apex Predator

The warcat of Rull is a stealthy predator that roams a large territory, hunting alone or with a mate. Even when nursing cubs, warcats hunt for themselves and teach their cubs to be self-sufficient. Warcats fear no challenge, preying on megafauna, giants, and even young dragons.

action->Piercing Fangs.name: Piercing Fangs
action->Piercing Fangs.description:
Requirements The warcat has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The warcat clamps on to the creature's neck. The creature takes @Damage[(3d12+10)[piercing]] damage plus @Damage[1d4[bleed]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:33|basic] save).

action->Pounce.name: Pounce
action->Pounce.description: The warcat of Rull Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the warcat began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after the attack.

Wight Spell Sniper.name: Wight Spell Sniper
Wight Spell Sniper.publicNotes:
Wights are intelligent undead spawned through inescapable cycles of spite. This spite might come from their own malevolent will in life, or can be instilled by necromantic rituals, typically involving the desecration of burial sites. Wights usually haunt burial grounds, catacombs, or other places of the dead. Their hunger is targeted toward the living—those whose pumping hearts and ruddy warmth inspire visceral hatred.

As many types of wights exist as types of people from which they might be created. Hulking brutes, skittering sneaks, and cunning tinkers all make for different wights with different niches to fill. The environment, too, plays a part in determining a wight's special abilities and defenses. Frost wights, for instance, can be found in parts of the world where exposure is a common end and the resentment of being left alone in the wild is a common source of spite. Durable and sustained by void energy, wights can last in harsh environments without decaying the way some lesser undead do.

A single wight can wreak significant havoc if it is compelled to rise from its tomb. Because creatures slain under a wight's curse can become wights as well, all it takes is a single wight and a handful of unlucky graveyard visitors to create a veritable horde of these undead. Thus, canny priests and adventurers know that the best solution to a wight problem is swift and total eradication. Care must be taken, though, to destroy wight spawn before attempting to destroy the parent wight, for spawn without a master gain the ability to create spawn of their own.

action->Grave Weapon.name: Grave Weapon
action->Grave Weapon.description: The wight is bound to a dagger it was buried with. Other wights can be bound to different weapons.

action->Drain Life.name: Drain Life
action->Drain Life.description:
When the wight sniper damages a living creature using an unarmed attack or ranged weapon, the sniper gains 2d6 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:22|options:inflicts:drained] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the wight sniper's attacks increase the value of the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.7EBdAHY7y06Bk4un]{Effect: Drain Life (Wight Spell Sniper)}

action->Drain the Prey.name: Drain the Prey
action->Drain the Prey.description:
Trigger The wight spell sniper kills a living creature

Effect The wight spell sniper breathes in the essence of the slain creature, making it easier to sense and hunt similar prey. The wight chooses one of the creature's traits (excluding rarity or size). Until the wight uses this ability again, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} creatures with that trait and a +2 circumstance bonus to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} creatures with that trait. The saving throw DCs of the wight's spells and abilities increase by 1 against creatures with the same trait.

action->Wyvern Bond.name: Wyvern Bond
action->Wyvern Bond.description: A wyvern rider automatically succeeds at checks to Command an Animal for a wyvern they're mounted on. While mounted, the wyvern acts on their turn.

action->Terrifying Strike.name: Terrifying Strike
action->Terrifying Strike.description: The wyvern rider attempts a weapon Strike against a target, shouting threats and curses. If it hits, the target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:28] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4} on a critical failure).

action->Weapon Adept.name: Weapon Adept
action->Weapon Adept.description: The wyvern rider can Swap between their falchion and composite shortbow, then Strike with the weapon they switched to.

action->Wyvern's Swoop.name: Wyvern's Swoop
action->Wyvern's Swoop.description:
Requirements The wyvern rider is mounting their wyvern

Effect The wyvern rider Commands their mount to Stride twice. At any point during this movement, they can Strike one enemy within reach or within the first range increment of their ranged weapon, with a +1 circumstance bonus to their attack roll. If they begin this movement at a higher point than their target, they deal an additional die of damage with this Strike.

Wraithwell.name: Wraithwell
Wraithwell.description: An orb of undeath draws creatures closer to a cursed existence.
Wraithwell.disable: @Check[religion|dc:27] to negate the forces of undeath (master), @Check[occultism|dc:30] (expert) to channel vital energy, @Check[thievery|dc:35] (master) to extricate the orb from the altar
Wraithwell.reset: The haunt deactivates 1 minute after all living creatures leave the area. After 1 hour, the haunt reactivates.
Wraithwell.routine: (1 action; void) The wraiths attack all living creatures in the area, dealing @Damage[(3d10+14)[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:32|basic] save). Creatures who fail their saves are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure) or increase their drained value by 1 (2 on a critical failure), up to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

action->Unholy Repair.name: Unholy Repair
action->Unholy Repair.description: The locus is sustained by the power of Tar-Baphon. The orb regains 10 Hit Points at the beginning of every round and is repaired by void damage.

action->Wraith Storm.name: Wraith Storm
action->Wraith Storm.description:
Trigger A creature touches the orb or attempts to disable the haunt

Effect A cyclone of wraiths spirals from the orb, grasping at all living creatures in the area. Targeted creatures must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:32] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2} on a critical failure).

action->Undeath Manifest.name: Undeath Manifest
action->Undeath Manifest.description: A creature who dies in the presence of the orb immediately becomes undead. Casting @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GUeRTriJkMlMlVrk]{Bind Undead} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xRgU9rrhmGAgG4Rc]{Peaceful Rest} in the presence of the orb automatically destroys the locus; other spells or abilities that combat undead might also do so, at GM discretion.

Yagrekash.name: Yagrekash
Yagrekash.publicNotes:
Einherjar are mighty warriors chosen by valkyries from the ranks of those slain in terrible and legendary battles. Forged from the souls of the greatest warriors, the implacable einherjar serve as the foot soldiers of pantheons, skilled in handto-hand combat and slaying giants.

Einherjar often come from warrior cultures, including Ulfen vikings (like the einherji represented in this entry), particularly fierce pirates from the Shackles, and even Osirian conquerors. They can be chosen from wherever war and might hold sway; many deities who hold the call of battle and the pursuit of physical power more sacred than concepts of good and evil might count einherjar warriors and valkyrie choosers of the slain among their chosen servitors. For example, Gorum, Besmara, and Sekhmet have all elevated fallen worshippers as einherjar. Einherjar dedicated to different deities often wield weapons or possess varying cosmetic appearances based on their deity's preferred weapon and their place of death; however, they're universally stalwart, implacable, and efficiently deadly. Einherjar with two-handed weapons or who arise from other backgrounds often have different abilities in place of Jotun Slayer and Instant Repair.

action->Challenge Foe.name: Challenge Foe
action->Challenge Foe.description: Yagrekash challenges one creature she can see to single combat, attempting to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} that target. This target remains her foe until itʼs defeated, it flees, or the encounter ends. Yagrekash gains a circumstance bonus to damage equal to her number of weapon damage dice against her designated foe but takes an equivalent circumstance penalty to damage against any other creature.

action->Mask of Pain.name: Mask of Pain
action->Mask of Pain.description:
Trigger Yagrekash succeeds at a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} check

Effect The creature Demoralized takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage and is then temporarily immune to additional damage from Mask of Pain for 24 hours.

action->Warmask of Power.name: Warmask of Power
action->Warmask of Power.description: Yagrekash's echo form retains her painted divine warmask dedicated to Zagresh, allowing her to cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Gb7SeieEvd0pL2Eh]{Sure Strike} as an innate divine spell once per day.

action->Half-Ear's Luck.name: Half-Ear's Luck
action->Half-Ear's Luck.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Zdagren takes a critical hit or critically fails a saving throw

Effect The critical hit becomes a normal hit, or the critical failure becomes a normal failure.

action->Double Slice.name: Double Slice
action->Double Slice.description: Zdagren makes two Strikes against the same target, one with each of his knuckle daggers. Zdagren combines the damage of any attacks that hit and applies precision damage, resistances, and weaknesses only once. Both attacks count toward his multiple attack penalty, but the penalty increases only after both attacks.

action->Formation Command.name: Formation Command
action->Formation Command.description: Each ally within 30 feet of Zdagren can Step, or Stride up to half their Speed. Each ally can benefit from Formation Command only once per round.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie brown bear is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Ripping Maul.name: Ripping Maul
action->Ripping Maul.description:
Requirements The zombie brown bear has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The zombie chews and rips at the target, dealing @Damage[(2d8+5)[piercing]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic] save.

Note: A DC was not provided for this ability by Paizo. The DC present here is a moderate DC for the creature level according to the GM Core creature building Tables.
